column5: Hey guys, we just moved back to Hamilton and am looking for somewhere to do some early season boat fishing. I have a 14' with a 15 hp. Was thinking about trying Lake Erie for some perch... Port Rowan are or Dunnville isn't that far either. Any thoughts?  Thanks,  LTF

Lakers bows brown it's like bits and bites out in the lake right now close on too  Go out in the lake on a flat day or a little chop head toward niagar falls floresent  rapalas spoons even crank bait you'll slam fish 12 to 30 feet of water bobs your uncle    Best time of year for it launch at 50 point even better troll toward niagara The boat will be fine the skipper needs to watch  Cheers Peter

Hey guys, we just moved back to Hamilton and am looking for somewhere to do some early season boat fishing. I have a 14' with a 15 hp. Was thinking about trying Lake Erie for some perch... Port Rowan are or Dunnville isn't that far either. Any thoughts?  Thanks,  LTF You can go out of pier 4 and ramp is FREE and fish the bay just do not eat the fish....

You have definitely got me thinking about doing some trolling in Lake Ontario! I have also watched the video of Fishmaster on Fishful Thinking and have also been thinking about that... what can you catch out of pier 4?
These were from a year ago on Simcoe
Is there perch there? There is a perch derby there next Sunday May 7th ... tickets available at Bill's Bait for it ....
